results.title: We Fact-Checked Trump’s Speech
results.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump made a number of claims about his policies and President Biden’s record. We checked them for accuracy.

results.byline: By Jazmine Ulloa, Alexandra Berzon, Jack Healy and Jim Rutenberg
results.title: In Arizona, Kari Lake’s Next Move Splits Factions of G.O.P.
results.abstract: The defeated candidate for governor is weighing whether to concede or mount a legal challenge. The choice is pitting old-guard Republicans against election deniers pushing for a fight.

media.caption: Kari Lake speaking to supporters in Scottsdale, Ariz., the night before Election Day.
media.copyright: Rebecca Noble for The New York Times

results.title: Same-Sex Marriage Rights Bill Clears a Crucial Senate Hurdle
results.abstract: Democrats made the same-sex marriage bill one of their first major agenda items in the postelection session, moving quickly to enact it while their party still controls both chambers.
des_facet: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

media.caption: Justice Clarence Thomas suggested in his opinion in the ruling that overturned the 50-year-old Roe v. Wade decision that the court also “should reconsider” precedents such as the one that enshrined marriage equality in 2015.
media.copyright: Yana Paskova/Getty Images

results.title: 4 University of Idaho Students Killed in ‘Crime of Passion’
results.abstract: The authorities were still piecing together what had transpired at a home near the University of Idaho campus.

media.caption: Officers are investigating the deaths of four University of Idaho students at an apartment complex south of campus on Sunday. The authorities said they were treating the case as a homicide.

results.title: Trump Is Running in 2024. The White House Has a Plan.
results.abstract: The president’s advisers have been working on a strategy for how the White House will respond to what they expect will be a constant stream of attacks from former President Donald J. Trump.

results.title: Yale and Harvard Law Schools Withdraw From the U.S. News Rankings
results.abstract: Citing flaws in the way the ratings are determined, the schools said they will stop participating, breaking away from the rankings industry.

results.title: Amazon Is Said to Plan to Lay Off Thousands of Employees
results.abstract: The job cuts of approximately 10,000, which would start as soon as this week, would focus on the company’s devices organization, retail division and human resources.

media.caption: The job cuts at Amazon would represent roughly 3 percent of its corporate employees and less than 1 percent of its global work force of more than 1.5 million.
media.copyright: Miles Fortune for The New York Times

results.title: Elon Musk Gives Twitter Employees a Deadline to Stay or Leave
results.abstract: Mr. Musk said that workers would need to answer through an online form by late Thursday and that those who stayed would be “working long hours at high intensity.”

media.caption: Elon Musk gave Twitter employees a deadline of 5 p.m. Eastern time on Thursday to decide if they wanted to work for him.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.title: Trump Wins Legal Battle Against His Niece
results.abstract: Mary Trump had claimed that the former president and other relatives had cheated her out of tens of millions of dollars. A judge dismissed her lawsuit.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump and his siblings were accused by their niece of cheating her out of tens of millions of dollars. This week, a judge dismissed her case.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Content Type: Personal Profile;Timothy Morales;Federal Security Service;Kherson (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.title: How an American Survived Hiding From the Russians in Kherson for 8 Months
results.abstract: Timothy Morales, a teacher, was trapped in the southern Ukrainian city during the occupation. To evade Russian troops, he rarely ventured out, switched apartments and pretended to be Irish.

media.caption: Timothy Morales, 56, an American teacher, managed to send his 10-year-old daughter to safety, but was trapped in occupied Kherson, Ukraine, during Russia’s occupation.
media.copyright: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Targeted’ Killings and No Arrest Bring Fear to University of Idaho
